snippet: The Arab world’s most sweeping revolution is foundering as the interim Libyan government seems to be paralyzed by its lack of power to control competing militias.
abstract: Arab world’s most sweeping revolution is foundering as the interim Libyan government seems to be paralyzed by its lack of power to control competing militias; legitimacy is most pressing matter in the country, and officials hope upcoming elections can convey authority to an elected body that can claim the mantle of popular will.
lead_paragraph: The Arab world’s most sweeping revolution is foundering as the interim Libyan government seems to be paralyzed by its lack of power to control competing militias.

headline.seo: Libya’s New Government Unable to Control Militias
headline.main: Libya Struggles to Curb Militias as Chaos Grows
headline.print_headline: Libya Struggles to Curb Militias as Chaos Grows
